001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.util.stream.IntStream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonSubTypes;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonSubTypes.Type;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonTypeInfo;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonTypeInfo.Id;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.OptBoolean;
013
014import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.BiFunction;
015import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
016
017/**
018 * Interface for probability distributions used in the modeling framework.
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * Supports a wide variety of statistical distributions including binomial,
022 * Poisson, negative binomial, gamma, normal, log-normal, beta, uniform, and
023 * empirical distributions. Provides sampling capabilities and statistical
024 * transformations.
025 */
026@JsonTypeInfo(
027                use = Id.NAME,
028                requireTypeIdForSubtypes = OptBoolean.TRUE
029)
030@JsonSubTypes(
031        { @Type(
032                        value = ImmutableBinomialDistribution.class,
033                        name = "binomial"
034        ), @Type(value = ImmutablePoissonDistribution.class,
035                        name = "poisson"
036        ), @Type(value = ImmutableNegBinomialDistribution.class,
037                        name = "neg-binomial"
038        ), @Type(value = ImmutableGammaDistribution.class,
039                        name = "gamma"
040        ), @Type(value = ImmutableNormalDistribution.class,
041                        name = "normal"
042        ), @Type(value = ImmutableLogNormalDistribution.class,
043                        name = "log-normal"
044        ), @Type(value = ImmutableLogitNormalDistribution.class,
045                        name = "logit-normal"
046        ), @Type(value = ImmutableBetaDistribution.class,
047                        name = "beta"
048        ), @Type(value = ImmutableUnimodalBetaDistribution.class,
049                        name = "unimodal-beta"
050        ), @Type(value = ImmutableUniformDistribution.class,
051                        name = "uniform"
052        ), @Type(value = ImmutablePointDistribution.class,
053                        name = "uniform"
054        ), @Type(value = ImmutableEmpiricalDistribution.class,
055                        name = "empirical"
056        )
057
058        }
059)
060public interface Distribution {
061
062        /** Number of samples used for empirical statistics */
063        int PRECISION = 10000;
064
065        /** Increment used for numerical differentiation */
066        double DX = 0.00001;
067
068        /**
069         * Combines this distribution with another using a specified combination
070         * function.
071         *
072         * @param with  the distribution to combine with
073         * @param using the function to combine the two distributions
074         * @return a resampled distribution representing the combination
075         */
076        default ResampledDistribution combine(
077                        Distribution with, BiFunction<Double, Double, Double> using
078        ) {
079                return ImmutableResampledDistribution.builder().setFirst(this)
080                                .setSecond(with).setCombiner(using).setLink(LinkFunction.NONE)
081                                .build();
082        }
083
084        /**
085         * Applies the link function to a value, transforming it according to the
086         * distribution's link.
087         *
088         * @return the link function used for distribution transformations
089         */
090        LinkFunction getLink();
091
092        /**
093         * The maximum value in the distribution's support. This is used for sampling
094         * and statistical calculations.
095         *
096         * @return the maximum value in the distribution's support
097         */
098        @Value.NonAttribute
099        double getMaxSupport();
100
101        /**
102         * The minimum value in the distribution's support. This is used for sampling
103         * and statistical calculations.
104         *
105         * @return the minimum value in the distribution's support
106         */
107        @Value.NonAttribute
108        double getMinSupport();
109
110        /**
111         * Generates multiple samples from the distribution for empirical analysis.
112         *
113         * @return array of PRECISION samples from the distribution
114         */
115        @JsonIgnore @Value.Redacted @Value.Derived
116        public default double[] getSamples() {
117                return IntStream.range(0, PRECISION).mapToDouble(i -> this.sample())
118                                .toArray();
119        }
120
121        /**
122         * Generates a random sample using the default sampler.
123         *
124         * @return a random sample from the distribution
125         */
126        @JsonIgnore
127        default double sample() {
128                return this.sample(Sampler.getSampler());
129        }
130
131        /**
132         * Generates a random sample from the distribution.
133         *
134         * @param rng the random number generator to use
135         * @return a random sample from the distribution
136         */
137        double sample(Sampler rng);
138
139}
